origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: The Class of 1924 at Cathedral College.

did.abstract: The History of Cathedral College’s Class of 1924 consists of various items which depict the years spent at Cathedral College by the class of 1924. The collection contains a book describing the members of the class, the professors, and what happened during the years, with some photographs. There are also newsletters printed by the members of the class describing the latest occurrences as well as jokes, and a few postcards.
did.physloc: Please contact the Marist College Archives and Special Collections for information regarding use and access of this collection.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The History of Cathedral College’s Class of 1924 consists of a book written by the class detailing their lives at school, newsletters printed up and distributed by the class, as well as photographs of the students and postcards received by the students.

acqinfo.p: The Cathedral College Collection of 1924 was donated to Marist College.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Cathedral College in New York, NY was a prep school for possible priesthood candidates. Boys attended the school for six years. The time spent by the boys of the class of 1924 spanned from 1918 through 1924.

accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: These records are organized into two series: 1) Class Newsletters, and 2) Record Book
Materials in each series maintain their original order or are arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.p: The Class Newsletters span from 1919 through 1920.

scopecontent.p: The Record Book is the class’s history, a written account of the class of 1924’s years at Cathedral College, from their freshmen year in 1919 until their senior year and graduation in 1924. It contains biographies of all the members of the class, descriptions of the activities participated in, everyday activities and the yearly class outings, jokes, photographs of class outings and the members of the class.
